wikipedia_page.main: This page is about the artist and illustrator. See Red Wilson (musician) for the American musician and fiddle-maker.Oscar Wilson  (1867 – 13 July 1930) was an English painter and illustrator who trained in both London and Belgium. He was a painter, illustrator, and joke cartoonist.

response: Marsh was also adept in the genre of short stories, publishing in literary periodicals such as Household Words, Cornhill Magazine, The Strand Magazine, and Belgravia, as well as in a number of book collections. The stories The Seen and the Unseen (1900), Marvels and Mysteries (1900), Both Sides of the Veil (1901) and Between the Dark and the Daylight (1902) (illustrated by Oscar Wilson) all feature an eclectic mix of humour, crime, romance and the occult.
* Ada Vernham: Actress (1900) The book was illustrated with a frontispiece by Oscar Wilson.
